title: Solving the Shortest Vector Problem in 2
abstract: We give a randomized 2 n+o(n) -time and space algorithm for solving the Shortest Vector Problem (SVP) on n-dimensional Euclidean lattices. This improves on the previous fastest algorithm: the deterministic ~O(4 n )-time and ~O(2 n )-space algorithm of Micciancio and Voulgaris (STOC 2010, SIAM J. Comp. 2013). In fact, we give a conceptually simple algorithm that solves the (in our opinion, even more interesting) problem of discrete Gaussian sampling (DGS). More specifically, we show how to sample 2 n/2  vectors from the discrete Gaussian distribution at  any parameter  in 2 n+o(n)  time and space. (Prior work only solved DGS for very large parameters.) Our SVP result then follows from a natural reduction from SVP to DGS.   In addition, we give a more refined algorithm for DGS above the so-called  smoothing parameter  of the lattice, which can generate 2 n/2  discrete Gaussian samples in just 2 n/2+o(n)  time and space. Among other things, this implies a 2 n/2+o(n) -time and space algorithm for 1.93-approximate decision SVP.
